FuncDef:
The web-redirect command forcibly redirects users in a domain to a URL.
The undo web-redirect command cancels the configuration.
By default, users in a domain are not forcibly redirected to a URL.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the index of a URL.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 5.

Specifies the URL to which users are forcibly redirected. The URL can be a domain name or an IP address, such as 1.1.1.1, http://1.1.1.1, www.huawei.com, and http://www.huawei.com.
The value is a string of 1 to 200 characters.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
You can dynamically redirect users to a URL as required. For example, when a user is detected attacking the network, you can forcibly redirect the user to a URL. To be specific, you can configure indexes of different URLs in BOD so that attackers can be forcibly redirected to corresponding URLs. Currently, the triggering condition is that the policy server delivers BOD whose service ID is all Fs.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
